question: Which two countries are connected by the "Takutu River Bridge"?
explanation: Guyana and Brazil are the two countries that are connected by the "Takutu River Bridge". The Takutu River Bridge is a bridge across the Takutu River, linking Lethem in Guyana to Bonfim in Brazil. It was completed in 2009 and opened on 31 July 2009. The bridge was a project within the Initiative for the Integration of the Regional Infrastructure of South America. The bridge is the only instance in the Americas of a land border where drivers must change from driving on the left (in Guyana) to driving on the right (in Brazil) or vice versa.
